intro: Tithymalus bridgesii, commonly known as the Bridgess' tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
